definitions.title: n.[m.]
definitions.body: siege-enclosure, siege, entrenchment;—alw. ´[[מ]] abs., exc. cstr. [[מְחוֹר]] Ez Eze 4:7 sf. [[מְחוּרְֶָ]] v:Eze 4:8; —

siege [[שָׂם עָלֵינוּ]] ´[[מ]] Mic 4:14 he hath laid siege to us, cf. ´[[וְנׇתַתָּ֫ עָלֶיהָ מ]] Ez Eze 4:2; ´[[בּוֹא בַמּ]] is come into a state of siege De 20:19, 2Ki 24:10, 2Ki 25:2, Je 52:5, cf. ´[[וְהָֽיְתָה בַמּ]] Ez Eze 4:3; ´[[יוֹשֶׁבֶת֠י בַּמּ]] Je 10:17; ´[[מְחוֹר יְרו]] Ez Eze 4:7 siege of Jerus., but also ´[[עַל־יְרו]]´[[מ]] Zec 12:2; ´[[יְמֵי מ]] of duration of siege Ez Eze 4:8, Eze 5:2; ´[[מֵי מ]] Na 3:14 water for a siege; in phr. [[וּבְמָחוֹק]] ´[[בְּמ]] in the siege and stress De 28:53, De 28:55, De 28:57, Je 19:9.

enclosure, i.e. siege-works De 20:20; late = ram-part Zec 9:3, ´[[עִיר מ]] entrenched city Ps 31:22 (al. besieged), Ps 60:11 (‖ Ps 108:11 [[מִבְחָר]] ´[[ע]]), cf. 2Ch 8:5; ´[[עָרִים לְמ]] 2Ch 11:5, [[בִּירוּשָׁלַם]] ´[[ישְׁבִים בְּמ]] 2Ch 32:10; ´[[מ]] Hb Hab 2:1 acc. to most (‖[[מִשְׁמֶרֶת]]); but We der. fr. [[נחר]], i.e. watch-tower, Now conj. [[מִחְפֶּה]] (cf. [[וַאֲחַפֶּה]] foll.); >Buhl conj. [[מְחָד]].—[[מ]]
